title: Manchester United transfer news: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer hints at January signings after two failed moves
text:
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer wants to strengthen his squad in January (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says the ‘money is there’ for the club to invest in January after admitting he missed out on at least two players last summer.

The Red Devils spent around £150m last summer on Aaron Wan-Bissaka, Harry Maguire and Daniel James but they recouped roughly half of that through the sale of Romelu Lukaku to Inter Milan.

As well as losing Lukaku, the likes of Ander Herrera, Marouane Fellaini, Antonio Valencia and Alexis Sanchez have all left the club since Solskjaer arrived.

Solskjaer was keen to sign Newcastle ace Sean Longstaff, while a move for Juventus’ Paulo Dybala fell through due to the Argentine’s wage demands.

Solskjaer made three signings last summer (Picture: Getty)

And, while the Norwegian admits that the club failed to bring in at least two new players last summer, Solskjaer says the club will try to make amends in January.

‘The money is there. We’ve been looking at players and we were close to a couple but it’s not right if you don’t get the right players. The money is there to strengthen in January and in the summer,’ Solskjaer

‘We’re planning and we’re looking. We’re refining our targets, but just before the summer transfer window ended, the ready-made players weren’t there. But the resources are there if the right players are available

‘January is a difficult window, anyway. But if there are players available and at the right price, I’m sure we will spend. There might be some experienced players who can come in and help the younger players – that might be worth the money.’

Metro.co.uk understands United are interested in Juventus striker Mario Mandzukic and will explore a short-term deal for the Croatian.

The club maintain an interest in Lyon striker Moussa Dembele but will not pay Newcastle’s £50m valuation of Longstaff.
